id: identifies the trust over which a trustee has some measure of control
name: identifies the trust over which a trustee has some measure of control

id: specifies the trust that a beneficiary is named in
name: specifies the trust that a beneficiary is named in

id: merge the legal person and formal organization class hierarchies.
name: merge the legal person and formal organization class hierarchies.

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC.
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate duplication with concepts in LCC.

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the FIBO 2.0 RFC.
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the FIBO 2.0 RFC.

id: trust in which legal ownership of the trust property is transferred to the trustee, but the trustor retains full power to revoke, modify or amend the trust
name: trust in which legal ownership of the trust property is transferred to the trustee, but the trustor retains full power to revoke, modify or amend the trust

id: party that establishes a trust and places property under the protection and management of one or more trustees for the benefit of at least one beneficiary
name: party that establishes a trust and places property under the protection and management of one or more trustees for the benefit of at least one beneficiary

id: A living trust is designed to allow for the easy transfer of the trust creator or settlor's assets while bypassing the often complex and expensive legal process of probate. Living trust agreements designate a trustee who holds legal possession of assets and property that flow into the trust.
name: A living trust is designed to allow for the easy transfer of the trust creator or settlor's assets while bypassing the often complex and expensive legal process of probate. Living trust agreements designate a trustee who holds legal possession of assets and property that flow into the trust.

id: A will could have more than one testamentary trust. The trustee named is responsible for managing and distributing the trustor's assets to the beneficiaries as directed in the will. Sometimes called a will trust, the testamentary trust is irrevocable.
name: A will could have more than one testamentary trust. The trustee named is responsible for managing and distributing the trustor's assets to the beneficiaries as directed in the will. Sometimes called a will trust, the testamentary trust is irrevocable.

id: Trusts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.
name: Trusts.rdf version of the ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) Annotation Vocabulary rather than the OMG's Specification Metadata vocabulary.

id: party that holds and manages assets for the benefit of another
name: party that holds and manages assets for the benefit of another

id: Irrevocable trusts also offer asset protection from future creditors and lawsuits.
name: Irrevocable trusts also offer asset protection from future creditors and lawsuits.

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to use the Commons Ontology Library (Commons) rather than the OMG's Languages, Countries and Codes (LCC), eliminating redundancies in FIBO as appropriate.

id: or one of the beneficiaries. In legal parlance, a trustor is called a settlor in the UK and a grantor in the US, whereas in common usage he or she may also be called a creator, donor, initiator, owner, or trust maker.
name: or one of the beneficiaries. In legal parlance, a trustor is called a settlor in the UK and a grantor in the US, whereas in common usage he or she may also be called a creator, donor, initiator, owner, or trust maker.

id: trust that cannot be modified, amended or terminated except under certain legal circumstances and typically not without the permission of the grantor's named beneficiary or beneficiaries
name: trust that cannot be modified, amended or terminated except under certain legal circumstances and typically not without the permission of the grantor's named beneficiary or beneficiaries

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO BE 1.0 FTF report.
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified per the issue resolutions identified in the FIBO BE 1.0 FTF report.

id: links a trust to a named trustee
name: links a trust to a named trustee

id: party empowered to act on behalf of the trustee to manage the assets of the trust
name: party empowered to act on behalf of the trustee to manage the assets of the trust

id: This ontology defines the fundamental common terms for trusts. Trusts are entities set up in terms of the applicable local statutes goerning trusts, and have as a minimum three specific, defined parties, known in many jurisdictions as trustor (sometimes sponsor), trustee and beneficiary. The terms in this ontology may be extended as necessary to represent specific types of trust, for example in the funds arena.
name: This ontology defines the fundamental common terms for trusts. Trusts are entities set up in terms of the applicable local statutes goerning trusts, and have as a minimum three specific, defined parties, known in many jurisdictions as trustor (sometimes sponsor), trustee and beneficiary. The terms in this ontology may be extended as necessary to represent specific types of trust, for example in the funds arena.

id: links a trust to a named beneficiary
name: links a trust to a named beneficiary

id: formal agreement that establishes a trust, whereby the trustor(s) gives the trustee(s) the responsibility to hold and manage assets for the beneficiary(ies)
name: formal agreement that establishes a trust, whereby the trustor(s) gives the trustee(s) the responsibility to hold and manage assets for the beneficiary(ies)

id: trust created during an individual's lifetime where a designated person, the trustee, is given responsibility for managing that individual's assets for the benefit of the eventual beneficiary
name: trust created during an individual's lifetime where a designated person, the trustee, is given responsibility for managing that individual's assets for the benefit of the eventual beneficiary

id: trust established in accordance with the instructions contained in a last will and testament
name: trust established in accordance with the instructions contained in a last will and testament

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to replace content that is now available in the OMG Commons Ontology Library (Commons) v1.1 (FND-380).

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate references to external dictionary sites that no longer resolve.
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to eliminate references to external dictionary sites that no longer resolve.

id: party for whose interest (benefit) an annuity, assignment (such as a letter of credit), contract, insurance policy, judgment, promise, trust, will, etc., is made
name: party for whose interest (benefit) an annuity, assignment (such as a letter of credit), contract, insurance policy, judgment, promise, trust, will, etc., is made

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to reflect the move of OrganizationMember from Parties to Organizations in FND.
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to reflect the move of OrganizationMember from Parties to Organizations in FND.

id: The trustee is legally obliged to make all trust-related decisions with the beneficiary's interests in mind, and may be liable for damages in the event of not doing so. Trustees may be entitled to a payment for their services, if specified in the trust agreement. In the specific case of the bond market, a trustee administers a bond issue for a borrower, and ensures that the issuer meets all the terms and conditions associated with the borrowing.
name: The trustee is legally obliged to make all trust-related decisions with the beneficiary's interests in mind, and may be liable for damages in the event of not doing so. Trustees may be entitled to a payment for their services, if specified in the trust agreement. In the specific case of the bond market, a trustee administers a bond issue for a borrower, and ensures that the issuer meets all the terms and conditions associated with the borrowing.

id: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add a number of kinds of trusts, clean-up extraneous concepts, and eliminate circularity and ambiguity in definitions.
name: Trusts.rdf version of this ontology was modified to add a number of kinds of trusts, clean-up extraneous concepts, and eliminate circularity and ambiguity in definitions.

id: A trust agreement typically states the (1) purpose for which the trust was established and fulfillment of which will terminate the trust, (2) details of the assets placed in the trust, (3) powers and limitations of the trustees, their reporting requirements, and other associated provisions, and (4) may also specify the trustees' compensation, if any. A trust agreement involving real estate requires its exact description and the trustor's express, written consent to create the trust to be valid.
name: A trust agreement typically states the (1) purpose for which the trust was established and fulfillment of which will terminate the trust, (2) details of the assets placed in the trust, (3) powers and limitations of the trustees, their reporting requirements, and other associated provisions, and (4) may also specify the trustees' compensation, if any. A trust agreement involving real estate requires its exact description and the trustor's express, written consent to create the trust to be valid.

id: fiduciary relationship and legal entity in which one party, known as a trustor, gives another party, the trustee, the right to hold title to and manage assets for the benefit of a third party, the beneficiary
name: fiduciary relationship and legal entity in which one party, known as a trustor, gives another party, the trustee, the right to hold title to and manage assets for the benefit of a third party, the beneficiary
